citation.article-title: Five new species of the genus Catenuloplanes: Catenuloplanes niger sp. nov., Catenuloplanes indicus sp. nov., Catenuloplanes atrovinosus sp. nov., Catenuloplanes castaneus sp. nov., and Catenuloplanes nepalensis sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Catenuloplanes castaneus sp. nov.
Catenuloplanes castaneus (cas.ta'ne.us. L. masc. adj. castaneus, chestnut colored)
The morphological, physiological, and chemotaxonomic characteristics are the same as those given previously for C. japonicus (10).

In addition, C. castaneus grows at 37Â°C and produces a scarlet soluble pigment in glycerol-asparagine agar (ISP medium 5), but does not produce any soluble pigment in inorganic salts-starch agar (ISP medium 4), tyrosine agar (ISP medium 7), and Bennett agar.
Resistant to penicillin and benzylpenicillin, but susceptible to cephaloridine and cephalexin.
he G+C content of the DNA is 72.0 to 72.4 mol%; the G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 72.4 mol%.
The type strain is strain IFO 15584 (= RA344).
